article_title: Former SAC Capital Manager Steinberg Sentenced to 3½ Years in Prison
article_text:
Michael Steinberg could go to prison for 31/2 years, the most senior former employee of SAC Capital Advisors LP to be convicted of insider trading, but in the eyes of a federal judge he is "a basically good man."

The words, uttered by U.S. District Judge Richard Sullivan, as he handed down the sentence on Friday, means the former portfolio manager could spend far less time in prison than prosecutors had sought. Prosecutors...

Michael Steinberg could go to prison for 31/2 years, the most senior former employee of SAC Capital Advisors LP to be convicted of insider trading, but in the eyes of a federal judge he is "a basically good man."
